result.execSummary:
The defendant John Walter Halfmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Walter Halfmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Walter Halfmann was found guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing [Modifiers: Penalty - Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • John Walter Halfmann was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • John Walter Halfmann was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2, 3 and 5.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John Joseph Leunig   DF:  John Walter Halfmann appeared. Case called at 11:05 am. Court reviews file and maximum penalties and fines for amended Counts 1 and 4 and the added Count 6. PSI was completed. Atty. Leunig has no corrections or disputes with PSI. ADA Hartung addresses Court and gives sentencing recommendation. Atty. Leunig responds. John Halfmann addresses Court. Court Outlines sentencing guidelines and reviews victim letter. Court Orders:
Ct 1: W/H 1 year probation
- Costs $243 plus $200, payable through probation
Ct 4: W/H 42 mo probation with conditions:
-  Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation
- 6 months St. Croix County jail, 4 months STAYED; remaining 2 months to be served in the following increments: 1 month in 2017 and 1 month in 2018, Huber is granted for employment and treatment
- Costs $243 plus $200, payable through probation
- DNA sample
- AODA assessment and follow through
- $2,327.05 restitution payable through probation
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing
- Follow through with treatment recommendations and keep scheduled appointments and take prescribed medications
-  NO CONTACT whatsoever with Jessica Z. except in a treatment setting or at a victim empathy seminar
- 120 hours community service
Ct 6: Sentence to 20 days St. Croix County jail, with 9 days credit, report by 8/5/16
- $1555 fine
- 16 mo license revocation with credit for admin suspension
- IID 16 mo
- meet with payment clerk 
- AODA assessment with driver's safety

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: John Joseph Leunig DF: John Walter Halfmann appeared. Case called at 11:09. State has filed an amended information. ADA Hartung updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 failure to obey traffic signal in15CF156. DE pleads G to amended Ct. 4 to 2nd degree reckless endangering safety in 15CF156 and guilty to Ct. 6 OWI 2nd in 15CF156. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. DE acknowledges the prior OWI.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct. 1,  and amended Ct. 4 and adding Ct. 6  in 15CF156. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3 and 5 in 15CF156. Court orders a PSI. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jessica Z.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
